column1: Andapa is a town and commune (Malagasy: firaisana) in northern Madagascar. It belongs to the district of Andapa
column2: which is a part of Sava Region. According to 2001 commune census the population of Andapa was 27
column3: 618.Andapa is served by a local airport. It is also a site of industrial-scale  mining. The majority 88% of the population are farmers
column4: while an additional 0.5% receives their livelihood from raising livestock. The most important crop is rice
column5: while other important products are beans
column6: tomatoes and vanilla.  Industry and services provide employment for 1.5% and 10% of the population

column1: The capital of the Sava Region
column2: Sambava is at a distance of 108 km.

column1: The administration office of the Anjanaharibe-Sud Reserve is situated in Andapa. The reserve is at 25 km from this town.

In addition to primary schooling the town offers secondary education at both junior and senior levels. A regional centre for distance education (CRTE) of the Centre National de Télé-Enseignement de Madagascar (CNETMAD) is located in Andapa.
